title: U.S. to give $2.5 million to help Venezuelans in Colombia: USAID
text: March 20, 2018 / 2:12 PM / in 42 minutes U.S. to give $2.5 million to help Venezuelans in Colombia: USAID Reuters Staff 1 Min Read WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The United States said on Tuesday it would provide $2.5 million in humanitarian aid to help support Venezuelans who have fled to neighboring Colombia. FILE PHOTO: People prepare to sleep on the floor of a sport center, where a community of homeless Venezuelan migrants stays, in Cucuta, Colombia January 24, 2018. REUTERS/Carlos Garcia Rawlins “In partnership with Colombia, this initial, and immediate commitment of $2.5 million will provide emergency food and health assistance for vulnerable Venezuelans and the Colombian communities who are hosting them,” Mark Green, administrator of the U.S. Agency for International Development, said in a statement. Reporting by Lesley Wroughton; Writing by Doina Chiacu; Editing by Franklin Paul
